TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TemplateInstanceAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Defines a metadata attribute that is used to specify the number of allowed instances of a template. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute> class allows you to mark a template property as one that allows single or multiple instantiations. A template that only allows a single instantiation can have the controls that are contained inside of it referenced. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone.ZoneTemplate%2A> property is an example of a property that can be instantiated only one time.
This <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute> class is optional. If a template property is not extended with a <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute> class, the default value, the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute.Multiple> field, is used. For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](~/docs/standard/attributes/index.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstance> enumeration and the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute> class. A custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control named `MyLoginViewA` overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView.AnonymousTemplate%2A> property and uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute> class to specify that only one instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView.AnonymousTemplate%2A> property is created.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute/cs/templateinstanceattribute.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute/vb/templateinstanceattribute.vb#1)]
The following code example is an ASPX file that uses the `MyLoginViewA` control and demonstrates how to access properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute> class.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute/cs/templateinstanceattribute.aspx#2)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute/vb/templateinstanceattribute.aspx#2)] -->

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified enumeration value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute Default

Docs.summary: Defines the default value for the class. This field is read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default behavior is to create multiple instances of the template using the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstance.Multiple> enumeration value.

Docs.summary: Gets the enumeration value that the current template instance represents.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that the current template instance represents.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The possible values are either the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute.Single> field or the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstance.Multiple> field.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute.Instances%2A> property. In the `Page_Load` event of an ASPX page, the `MyLoginViewA` custom control's <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute> class for the `AnonymousTemplate` property is queried.
For the definition of `MyLoginViewA` control, see <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute>.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute/cs/templateinstanceattribute.aspx#3)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute/vb/templateinstanceattribute.aspx#3)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IsDefaultAttribute() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a value indicating if the current object is the same as the default object.
Docs.returns: if the value of the current instance of is the default; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute> class is the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute.Multiple> field.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute.IsDefaultAttribute%2A> method. In the `Page_Load` event of an ASPX page, the `MyLoginViewA` custom control's <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute> class for the `AnonymousTemplate` property is queried.
For the definition of the `MyLoginViewA` control, see <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute>.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute/cs/templateinstanceattribute.aspx#3)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute/vb/templateinstanceattribute.aspx#3)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute Multiple

Docs.summary: Creates an instance of the class as one representing a template that will be instantiated multiple times. This field is read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute.Multiple> field is accessed, a new template instance is instantiated multiple times.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute Single

Docs.summary: Creates an instance of the class as one representing a template that will be instantiated a single time. This field is read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute.Single> field is accessed, a new template instance is instantiated a single time.
